item.title: Google aims to boost productivity with AI Agent tool - TechTarget
item.description:
Google Aims to Boost Productivity with AI Agent Tool

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: TechTarget

Google has unveiled a new tool called Google Agentspace, designed to use AI agents and search technology to improve employee productivity by simplifying document searches.

  • Google Agentspace helps users accomplish complex tasks requiring planning, research, and content generation.
  • The tool integrates with Google's NotebookLM, enhancing the way employees interact with information.
  • It provides a unified search platform to minimize time spent searching for internal documents.
  • Challenges include training employees on effective use and handling responsible AI concerns.

"Agents need better memory, which is the ability to remember things and contextualize the responses." - Arun Chandrasekaran, Analyst at Gartner

Google's introduction of Agentspace marks a significant step in enhancing workplace efficiency through advanced AI tools.

item.title: AMD launches new film to showcase its Ryzen AI Pro Series Processors - afaqs!
item.description:
AMD Launches #BusinessesLoveAMD Campaign for Ryzen AI Pro Series Processors

Publication Date: December 16, 2024
Source: afaqs

AMD has launched its latest campaign #BusinessesLoveAMD in India, focusing on the Ryzen AI Pro Series Processors. The campaign highlights performance and AI capabilities for various business sectors, using a storytelling approach to engage audiences.

  • The campaign is designed for IT teams, finance teams, and CEOs.
  • It showcases speed, performance, and AI capabilities of the Ryzen AI Pro Series Processors.
  • Collaboration with production house The Yellow Shutter.
  • Storytelling format focuses on everyday challenges faced by professionals.
“At AMD, we are committed to pushing the boundaries of innovation...” - Mukesh Bajpai, director marketing, AMD India.

In conclusion, the #BusinessesLoveAMD campaign is a creative effort by AMD to connect with its target audience through relatable storytelling, highlighting innovative solutions for modern workplaces.

item.title: Realme 14 Pro Global Launch Date Announced; Realme 14 Pro+ Spotted on China’s 3C Certification Site - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Realme 14 Pro Launch Date Announced; 14 Pro+ Spotted on 3C Website

Publication Date: December 19, 2023

Source: Gadgets 360

Realme has announced the launch date for the Realme 14 Pro, which is set to be unveiled at a media event on December 19 in Copenhagen. The company is also expected to launch the Realme 14 Pro+ around the same time.

  • The Realme 14 Pro will be officially launched on December 19 in Copenhagen.
  • The Realme 14 Pro+ has appeared on the China Compulsory Certification (3C) website with details on fast charging.
  • The Realme 14 Pro series will feature Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipsets.
  • The Realme 14x is also set to launch soon with a MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset and a 6,000mAh battery.
“Design meets innovation” - Realme's teaser for the 14 Pro launch.

The upcoming Realme phones are generating a lot of buzz with their expected features and innovations, showing Realme's commitment to enhancing its smartphone lineup.

item.title: Apple Announces Best iPhone Apps And Games of 2024: Full List Here - News18
item.description:
Apple Announces Best iPhone Apps And Games of 2024: Full List Here

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: News18

Apple has unveiled the winners of the 2024 App Store Awards, highlighting exceptional apps and games across various categories recognized for their design and innovation.

  • iPhone App of the Year: Kino (LUX Optics Inc.) - A video camera app with film features.
  • iPad App of the Year: Moises (Moises Systems Inc.) - An AI app for musicians with audio features.
  • Mac App of the Year: Adobe Lightroom (Adobe Inc.) - A photo editing tool with effective search capabilities.
  • Apple Vision Pro App of the Year: What If…? – An Immersive Story (Disney) - A storytelling app with graphical experiences.
  • Apple Watch App of the Year: Lumy (Raja V) - A sun exposure tracking app.
  • Apple TV App of the Year: F1 TV (Formula One Digital Media Limited) - Offers live races and highlights for F1 fans.
  • iPhone Game of the Year: AFK Journey (Farlight Games) - A tactical adventure game.
  • iPad Game of the Year: Squad Busters (Supercell) - A multiplayer logistical strategy game.
  • Mac Game of the Year: Thank Goodness You’re Here! (Panic, Inc.) - An absurd adventure game.
  • Apple Vision Pro Game of the Year: THRASHER: Arcade Odyssey (Puddle, LLC) - An engaging arcade game.
  • Apple Arcade Game of the Year: Balatro+ (Playstack Ltd.) - A strategic card game.

Cultural Impact Winners: Oko, EF Hello, Daily Art, NYT Games, The Wreck, Do You Really Want To Know? 2.

item.title: Classy analog watches for men: Top 10 timeless timepieces for every style and occasion - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Classy Analog Watches for Men: Top 10 Timeless Timepieces for Every Style and Occasion

Publication Date: December 16, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

An analog watch for men is more than just a time-telling device—it’s a timeless accessory that complements personal style. From casual outings to formal events, analog watches are versatile companions that add sophistication to any look.

  • The article discusses the best analog watches for men, highlighting their versatility and elegance.
  • It features a variety of watches suitable for different occasions, including formal and casual events.
  • Each watch is accompanied by specifications, assisting readers in making informed choices.
“Selecting the right analog watch for men depends on your style, budget, and functional needs.”

This guide empowers readers to choose the perfect watch that suits their lifestyle, ensuring they stay stylish and punctual.

item.title: How talent from top tech services companies is changing the game for laggards - Mint
item.description:
How Talent from Top Tech Services Companies is Changing the Game for Laggards

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Company Business News

Bengaluru: When Pune-based Persistent Systems crossed the $1 billion revenue mark in FY23, they credited their success to a strong team and leadership under CEO Sandeep Kalra. The company has seen significant revenue growth from $501 million in 2020 to $1.18 billion in FY24.

  • Persistent Systems marked a significant financial milestone, crossing the $1 billion revenue mark.
  • CEO Sandeep Kalra joined in May 2019 and has been pivotal in the company's growth.
  • The company grew from $501 million revenue in 2020 to $1.18 billion in FY24.
“Credit goes to our team.” - Anand Deshpande, Founder of Persistent Systems

This growth exemplifies how talent and leadership in tech services are pivotal for companies striving for advancement in the sector.

item.title: Lava launches Blaze Duo 5G smartphone with Secondary AMOLED Display at ₹14,999 - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Lava launches Blaze Duo 5G smartphone with Secondary AMOLED Display at ₹14,999

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: CNBC TV18

Lava International Limited has launched its new smartphone, the Blaze Duo 5G, featuring a secondary AMOLED rear display at an attractive price of ₹14,999. Sales will start on Amazon from December 20.

  • Secondary 1.58-inch AMOLED rear display for selfies and notifications.
  • 6.67-inch 120Hz curved AMOLED main display.
  • Powered by MediaTek Dimensity 7025 chipset.
  • Available in configurations with 6GB or 8GB of RAM, and 128GB of storage.
  • 64MP primary camera with a 2MP macro lens, plus a 16MP front camera.
  • 5000mAh battery with 33W fast charging support.
  • Runs on Android 14 with upgrade options.
“The secondary display allows users to take selfies, view notifications, receive calls, and control music without using the main screen.”

The Lava Blaze Duo 5G offers robust specifications at a competitive price, signaling Lava's commitment to innovation in the smartphone market.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy M16 5G, Galaxy F16 5G Reportedly Spotted on BIS Suggesting Imminent India Launch - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy M16 5G, Galaxy F16 5G Could Launch in India Soon

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Gadgets 360

Samsung is expected to launch its new budget smartphones, the Galaxy M16 5G and F16 5G, in India soon, as indicated by their listing on the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) website.

  • The Galaxy M16 5G and F16 5G have been spotted on a certification site, hinting at an imminent release.
  • These models are expected to succeed the Galaxy M15 5G and F15 5G.
  • The M16 5G could feature specifications similar to the recently launched Galaxy A16 5G.
  • It may support dual-band Wi-Fi and run on Android 14-based One UI 6.
  • The device was also seen on Geekbench, suggesting a potential MediaTek Dimensity 6300 SoC.
"The Samsung Galaxy A16 5G launched in India with a MediaTek Dimensity 6300 SoC in October."

The upcoming Samsung Galaxy M16 5G and Galaxy F16 5G aim to capture the budget smartphone market in India with competitive features and performance.

item.title: Do not download Android 15 Beta on your Nothing Phone 2a Plus: Here’s why - India TV News
item.description:
Why You Should Avoid Downloading Android 15 Beta on Your Nothing Phone 2a Plus

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

Nothing has expanded its Android 15 beta program to include the Phone 2a Plus. While the beta offers a glimpse into the latest features, it comes with potential drawbacks.

  • Key concerns with the new beta update on Phone 2a:
    1. Data loss risk: The update might erase personal data during installation.
    2. Performance issues: The software may contain bugs or glitches.
    3. Complex process: Manual installation is not user-friendly.

Experts recommend waiting for a stable OTA update to avoid performance risks.

Snake Game Returns on Nothing Phones

In an interesting move, Nothing has reintroduced the classic snake game, which can be installed on Nothing Phone 1, Phone 2, and Phone 2a series.

item.title: Windows Users Can Finally Share Files With iPhones: All Details - News18
item.description:
Windows Users Can Finally Share Files With iPhones: All Details

Publication Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

Microsoft has introduced a major update to its file-sharing capabilities that allows iPhone users to share files seamlessly with their Windows PCs.

  • The Phone Link app now supports file transfers between iPhones and Windows PCs.
  • This feature is currently in testing and available only to Windows Insiders.
  • Users need iOS 16 or later on their iPhone and updated versions of the Phone Link app on both devices.
  • The link features allow easy sharing of photos and documents between iPhones and Windows PCs.
“Windows and iOS devices have never got along well, but things could be changing with this new update.”

This new file-sharing functionality represents a significant improvement in collaboration between Windows and iPhone users, making it easier to share content across platforms.

item.title: Second One UI 7 beta update removes ‘Secured by Knox’ watermark from app drawer - SamMobile - Samsung news
item.description:
Second One UI 7 beta update removes ‘Secured by Knox' watermark from app drawer

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: SamMobile

Samsung released the second Android 15-based One UI 7 beta update for the Galaxy S24 series today, introducing significant changes, including the removal of the persistent 'Secured by Knox' watermark in the app drawer.

  • The update comes less than two weeks after the first beta update.
  • Samsung has fixed several bugs and issues as listed in the changelog.
  • The 'Secured by Knox' watermark has been removed, improving the aesthetics of the app drawer.
  • Users have noted that not all changes are documented in the official notes.
“Samsung said the watermark would be removed in the stable version of One UI 7, but it turns out the necessary change has already been made.”

This update is expected to enhance the overall user experience for Galaxy S24 series owners, and users can look forward to more updates as they emerge.

item.title: iPhone 15 Pro price drops on Vijay Sales - India Today
item.description:
iPhone 15 Pro Price Drops Significantly on Vijay Sales

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India Today

The iPhone 15 Pro is now available for under Rs 1 lakh, marking a significant price drop at Vijay Sales.

  • The current listing price of the iPhone 15 Pro is Rs 1,02,190.
  • Originally launched at Rs 1,34,999, consumers benefit from a Rs 32,809 discount.
  • Additional Rs 4,500 discount on HDFC bank card EMI brings the price down to Rs 97,690.
  • Features a 48-megapixel primary camera with a 3x telephoto lens.
  • The iPhone 15 Pro offers a similar experience to the newer iPhone 16 Pro at a lower cost.
  • Supports upcoming Apple Intelligence features and includes a customizable Action Button.
The iPhone 15 Pro is a solid Pro model that can offer almost a similar experience at a lower price.

This price drop makes the iPhone 15 Pro a compelling choice for consumers looking for high-end features at a reduced price.

item.title: Google Maps Will Be Deleting Your Location History. Know How To Protect It - NDTV
item.description:
Google Maps Will Be Deleting Your Location History. Know How To Protect It

Publication Date: Not specified. Source: Not specified.

Google's Timeline feature, originally known as Location History, will go offline on June 9, 2025, prompting users to save their location data to avoid deletion.

Key Points:

  • Timeline feature changing to save data on devices instead of in the cloud.
  • Data older than three months will be deleted unless saved by the user.
  • 90 days of data will transfer to devices after the deadline.
  • Timeline data won't be accessible on web browsers.
  • Instructions for users to keep Timeline data include updating app settings.

Notable Quotes:

"Timeline is changing and will now be created on your device. You’ll need to choose settings for your data by June 9, 2025 to avoid losing visits and routes."

This shift aims to enhance user privacy, although there are concerns about losing valuable travel data.

item.title: Google Introduces Android XR Platform for Mixed Reality Development - XR Today
item.description:
Google Introduces Android XR Platform for Mixed Reality Development

Publication Date: Not specified Source: XR Today

Google has announced the launch of Android XR, a platform for developing mixed reality (MR) applications, facilitating a range of immersive experiences by integrating with Google Play Services.

  • Android XR simplifies MR application development with tools and APIs compatible with various hardware.
  • It supports augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) experiences, overlaying digital content on the real world.
  • Google is collaborating with hardware manufacturers like Samsung and Qualcomm to introduce devices for the platform.
  • The platform will be available for developers in early 2025, with no pricing details disclosed yet.

“For Qualcomm partners like Lynx, Sony and XREAL, we are opening a path for the development of a wide array of Android XR devices to meet the diverse needs of people and businesses.”

The introduction of Android XR signals a significant step in creating a developer ecosystem focused on mixed reality alongside existing Google technologies.

item.title: Vivo Y300 With MediaTek Dimensity 6300 SoC Goes Official in China - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Vivo Y300 With MediaTek Dimensity 6300 SoC Goes Official in China

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: Gadgets 360

The Vivo Y300 has been launched in China as part of the Y series, featuring a MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset, a large battery, and impressive display specifications.

  • Equipped with a 6.77-inch AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Offers a dual rear camera setup with a 50MP primary sensor.
  • Packs a large 6,500mAh battery with 44W fast charging support.
  • Available starting at CNY 1,399 for the 8GB + 128GB variant.
  • Launch includes three color options: Green Pine, Snow White, and Star Diamond Black.
“The Vivo Y300 5G is already available in India since last month with a price tag of Rs. 21,999 for the 8GB RAM + 128GB storage option.”

In conclusion, the Vivo Y300 offers high-end features at a competitive price, making it an attractive option for consumers looking for a new smartphone.
